meanings.definition: A skin disease in mammals caused by parasitic mites.
meanings.sent1: The poor dog had mange, making its skin itchy and sore.
meanings.sent2: The vet diagnosed the cat with mange after noticing the red patches on its fur.
meanings.sent3: The zookeeper joked that the monkeys might catch mange if they don't keep themselves clean.
meanings.sent4: The spread of gossip in the office was like mange, infecting everyone with discomfort.
meanings.sent5: The image of the mangy dog with mange stuck in my mind, reminding me of the skin disease.

meanings.definition: To affect with or as if with mange.
meanings.sent1: The stray cat's constant scratching seemed to mange its fur.
meanings.sent2: If you don't wash your hands, you might accidentally mange the germs around.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon managed to mange the picnic by stealing all the food.
meanings.sent4: Her negative comments seemed to mange the mood of the party, making everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent5: The careless behavior of the children could easily mange the delicate balance of the ecosystem.

meanings.definition: An infestation of mites in mammals.
meanings.sent1: The vet confirmed that the rabbits had an infestation of mange in their fur.
meanings.sent2: The farm was struggling with a mange outbreak among the livestock.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they learned about the tiny mange mites living on the dog.
meanings.sent4: The city faced a serious issue with mange infestations in stray animals.
meanings.sent5: The documentary highlighted the dangers of neglecting mange infestations in wildlife.
